case_vignette: A 62-year-old man comes to the physician because of a skin lesion on his nose! The patient has had the lesion for 11 months and it has increased in size over the past few months! He is a farmer and lives together with his wife! His mother died of metastatic melanoma at the age of 67 years! The patient has smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for the past 30 years and drinks 1–2 glasses of whiskey on weekends! His temperature is 36!8°C (98!2°F), pulse is 75/min, and blood pressure is 140/78 mm Hg! Examination of the skin shows a nontender lesion at the right root of the nose! An image of the lesion is shown!
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a skin lesion on my nose that has been growing over the past several months.
Can you describe the appearance of the lesion?
The image of the lesion shows it at the right root of my nose.
Could you please describe the color, texture, and if there are any irregular borders or bleeding?
I'm sorry, but I can only tell you that the lesion is located at the right root of my nose; the description of its color, texture, and other details aren't detailed in my initial statement.
Has the lesion caused any pain or itching?
The lesion is not tender, so it doesn't cause any pain.
Have you noticed any changes in sensation or numbness around the area of the lesion?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in sensation or numbness around the area of the lesion.
Do you have any history of excessive sun exposure or sunburns particularly affecting your face?
As a farmer, I have had extensive exposure to the sun.
Do you have any family history of skin cancer or related skin conditions?
Yes, my mother died of metastatic melanoma at the age of 67 years.
Final Diagnosis: Basal Cell Carcinoma

The patient's mother passed away from metastatic melanoma at the age of 67.
